movie_title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
introduction: Size is the most under appreciated regulators of living things. Let us demonstrate that by throwing

vocabulary.definition: not given enough recognition or praise for something
vocabulary.example: Size is the most underappreciated regulator of living things.
Life spans seven orders of magnitude, from invisible bacteria to blue whales.

vocabulary.definition: relating to or resulting from motion
vocabulary.example: The more mass you have, the higher your kinetic energy before you hit the ground.

vocabulary.definition: the action or property of like molecules sticking together
vocabulary.example: Water molecules are attracted to each other through a force called cohesion.

vocabulary.definition: serving or tending to drive away or ward off
vocabulary.example: Insects evolved to be water repellent to survive the force of water surface tension.

vocabulary.definition: spread or cause to spread over a wide area or among a large number of people
vocabulary.example: Oxygen diffuses into the air bubble from the water, allowing insects to breathe underwater.
